intro: Asphodelus aestivus var. genuinus, commonly known as the summer asphodel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Mediterranean. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and tall, slender flower stalks that bear clusters of pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry meadows and rocky habitats. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil and support local pollinator populations.
